org.strongback.components

Interface LimitedMotor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Motor, Requirable, SpeedController, SpeedSensor, Stoppable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TalonController, TalonSRX

    @Immutable
public interface LimitedMotor
extends Motor
    A Motor that is bounded by two Switch components at the extremes of it's range of motion.

    LimitedMotor has three possible positions:

    1. HIGH - the high switch is active
    2. LOW - the low switch is active
    3. UNKNOWN - neither switch is triggered (or both switches are triggered, typically as the result of a problem with the robot hardware)

    and three possible directions:

    1. FORWARD - the underlying motor is moving to the high limit
    2. REVERSE - the underlying motor is moving to the low limit
    3. STOPPED - the underlying motor is not moving
    See Also:
    Motor, Switch

    • Nested Class Summary

      The possible positions for a limited motor.

        LimitedMotor setSpeed(double speed)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining of methods; never null

      • getForwardLimitSwitch

        Switch getForwardLimitSwitch()
        Get the switch that signals when this motor reaches its limit in the forward direction.
        Returns:
        the forward direction limit switch; never null

      • getReverseLimitSwitch

        Switch getReverseLimitSwitch()
        Get the switch that signals when this motor reaches its limit in the reverse direction.
        Returns:
        the reverse direction limit switch; never null

      • isAtForwardLimit

        default boolean isAtForwardLimit()
        Tests if this LimitedMotor is at the high limit. This is equivalent to calling getForwardLimitSwitch().isTriggered().
        Returns:
        true if this LimitedMotor is at the forward limit; false otherwise

      • isAtReverseLimit

        default boolean isAtReverseLimit()
        Tests if this LimitedMotor is at the low limit. This is equivalent to calling getReverseLimitSwitch().isTriggered().
        Returns:
        true if this LimitedMotor is at the low limit; false otherwise

      • forward

        default boolean forward(double speed)
        Moves this LimitedMotor towards the forward limit. This method should be called once per loop until the movement is completed.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed at which the underlying Motor should spin in the forward direction
        Returns:
        true if the motor remains moving, or false if it has reached the forward limit

      • reverse

        default boolean reverse(double speed)
        Moves this LimitedMotor towards the reverse limit. This method should be called once per loop until the movement is completed.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed at which the underlying Motor should spin in the reverse direction
        Returns:
        true if the motor remains moving, or false if it has reached the forward limit

      • getPosition

        default LimitedMotor.Position getPosition()
        Gets the current position of this LimitedMotor. Can be HIGH, LOW, or UNKNOWN.
        Returns:
        a LimitedMotor.Position representing the current position of this LimitedMotor

      • create

        static LimitedMotor create(Motor motor,
                           Switch forwardSwitch,
                           Switch reverseSwitch)
        Create a LimitedMotor around the given motor and switches.
        Parameters:
        motor - the Motor being limited; may not be null
        forwardSwitch - the Switch that signals the motor reached its limit in the forward direction, or null if there is no limit switch
        reverseSwitch - the Switch that signals the motor reached its limit in the reverse direction, or null if there is no limit switch
        Returns:
        the limited motor; never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the motor parameter is null
